snippet: A year ago, counties turned down an offer of state money to keep the most violent juvenile offenders in their jails rather than in state facilities. The counties said no. Now they have to pay the state for housing those offenders.
lead_paragraph: A year ago, counties turned down an offer of state money to keep the most violent juvenile offenders in their jails rather than in state facilities. The counties said no. Now they have to pay the state for housing those offenders.

headline.seo: Counties’ Refusal of Money for Violent Juvenile Offenders Turns Into a Big Bill From the State
headline.main: Money Refused Could Become Money Owed
headline.print_headline: Money Refused Could Become Money Owed

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Center on Juvenile and Criminal Justice
